Issues.Title: fix(ivy): dissable test which rely on DebugElement in WebWorker
Issues.Body:
Current implementation of `DebugElement` relies on the fact that it can extract information from the `Element` in a lazy fashion. (Previous `DebugRenderer2` implementation eagerly created `DebugElement` and populated it with all of the information.) This is a breaking change for WebWorker implementation if the `WebWorkerRendererFactory2` is combined with `RenderDebug2`, which may be in some tests. (The production build with `RenderDebug2` should continue to work)

The reason we are doing this is that the new `DebugElement` implementation is more lightweight, tree shakable, and does not need `RenderDebug2` factory which means that it can be used form the browser console for quick debugging even of the production apps.  We believe that the new capabilities provide sufficient amount of value to justify breaking the rare case of where `WebWorkerRendererFactory2` is combined with `RenderDebug2`)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): dissable test which rely on DebugElement in WebWorker" (#27895)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): clone queries correctly for multiple component instances
Issues.Body:
When requesting a queries instance for a node, it was previously
decided whether it needs to be cloned if the node was not already marked
as hosting a query. This check is in place to have only a single queries
instance per node.

The issue with this approach is that no clone is created for subsequent
instantiations of a component, as the TNode is already marked as hosting
a query during first template pass, whereas the cloning of queries
should be independent of first template pass.

To overcome this issue, the queries are assigned an owner TNode such
that it can reliably be determined if a clone needs to be created.

Issues.Title: @angular/language-service doesn't understand type guards in binding expressions
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/language-service ### Is this a regression? Unknown. ### Description Given the following code: ```ts import {Component, Input} from '@angular/core'; export interface KeyValuePair { name: string; value: any; } @Component({ selector: 'adt-test-component', template: `
{{item.name}}
` }) export class TestComponent { @Input() item: KeyValuePair | false; } ``` The Angular language service underlines `item.name` in red, with the error: ``` ng: Identifier 'name' is not defined. '' does not contain such a member ``` The expression is valid and should not be an error. If the expression were in TypeScript instead of in a binding, the TypeScript compiler would not complain. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-vqmp9j ## üåç Your Environment ``` Angular CLI: 7.1.1 Node: 10.14.1 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 7.1.1 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core ... elements, forms, http, language-service, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.11.1 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.11.1 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.11.1 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.11.1 @angular-devkit/core 7.1.1 @angular-devkit/schematics 7.1.1 @ngtools/json-schema 1.1.0 @ngtools/webpack 7.1.1 @schematics/angular 7.1.1 @schematics/update 0.11.1 ng-packagr 4.4.5 rxjs 6.3.3 typescript 3.1.3 webpack 4.23.1 ``` Editor: WebStorm 2018.3.2, on Mac OSX

Issues.Title: Query method returns [NodeList] instead of [Element, Element]
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/animations ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The query function uses a spread operator on the result of querySelectAll. Since NodeList is not an array this sometimes causes problems in IE11 and then the query function returns `[NodeList]` instead of `[Element, Element]`. The line causing the issue can be seen here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/animations/browser/src/render/shared.ts#L175 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The issue only occurs in IE11, but I was not able to make a minimal reproduction. We did run into the bug in our project when using the angular material menu. (https://github.com/NationalBankBelgium/stark/blob/master/packages/stark-ui/src/modules/table/components/column.component.html#L24). To see the effect of the issue navigate to https://stark.nbb.be/showcase/latest/demo/table and click the filter icon. At this point an error is raised from`getComputedStyle`, `No Such Interface Supported` or `Unable to get property 'opacity' of undefined or null reference` depending on the version of Windows. After some investigation I discovered that this was originally caused by the query function returning `[NodeList]` instead of `[Element, Element]`. I will also make a PR with a possible solution. ## üî• Exception or Error

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Some Chinese Browsers don't fully support servicer worker. Wechat browser, for example, behaves badly. It causes white page which is very horrible! So, add an api to forbid loading servicer worker for some special browsers which can avoid white page.

Issues.Title: Run events and lifecycles hooks in per-component zones
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

@angular/core

### Description

`OnPush` is a necessity in any large app, but it is error-prone to markForCheck on every subscription, await, setTimeout, etc. A common case is HttpClient requests.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Each component should have its own forked Zone for running hooks and event handlers. Then, Angular can automatically markForCheck() on the proper component.

If this happened, OnPush would virtually always work, improving many apps performance with minimal development.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I don't know any easy way to add this after. A custom decorators could take care of part, but there isn't DI that would allow me to get a ChangeDetectorRef.

I'm not aware of any injectable today that I could hook and get this to work. Plus per-component injection scope is verbose. (#18015)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Run events and lifecycles hooks in per-component zones" (#27885)

Issues.Title: i18n: change default language from english
Issues.Body:
# üöÄi18n: Add possibility to specify default language different from english ### Relevant Package angular v.7 ### Description By now if you want to add i18n, you must use english as a default language ‚Äì use it in all templates and set as base language in `.xlf` files for translate. Related question: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53947461/ng2-i18n-use-not-english-as-a-default-language-in-templates ### Describe the solution you'd like I'd like to have possibility to set default language by myself. Because sometimes app is multi language but there is no english in language list. Or you want to use another language in templates. It is very useful when you need to add i18n _after_ the project is released for default language. I suggest to use something like in `angular.json`: ``` "configurations": { "fr": { "defaultLanguage": "true", ... } ``` ### Current workaround By now I have found a workaround: never build app with default language and for _really default language_ specify translations the same with source. For example if my default language is french and second language is spanish: ```

Bonjour

``` `angular.json` ``` "configurations": { "fr": { "i18nFile": "app/assets/i18n/messages.fr.xlf", "i18nLocale": "fr" }, "es": { "i18nFile": "app/assets/i18n/messages.es.xlf", "i18nLocale": "es" } } ``` messages.fr.xlf ``` .... Bonjour Bonjour ``` messages.es.xlf ``` .... Bonjour Hola ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n: change default language from english" (#27883)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/elements@7.1.4

### Description
This issue is happening when i try to dynamically load data an array, and display by *ngFor .
Data dosent get rendered, but by refreshing page several times, data sudenly get rendered. 
Normal behaviour should be that data get rendered, but it dosent. I have tested it with static data array, and every thing works fine *ngFor renders the data in static array. 

This issue is already put up as an issue at [@pnp/spfx](https://github.com/pnp/generator-spfx/issues/140) Team, and they pointed it as a BUG in Angular Elements...


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
[GitHub ](https://github.com/gonadn/pnpspfx)repo for minimal reproduction

Issues.Title: Default target should be ES6 in generated tsconfig.json
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->

```
Angular CLI: 7.1.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.11.4
@angular-devkit/core              7.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.1.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.1.4
@schematics/angular               7.1.4
@schematics/update                0.11.4
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.23.1
```

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->
The default `"target"` in `tsconfig.json` generated by `ng new` should be `"es6"`, not `"es5"`.

Reasons:
1. Modern browsers are being optimized for ES6 now. ES5 is no longer necessary or optimal.
2. Smaller generated code files.
3. Fewer problems out-of-the box (without having to use flags that new users might not know about), e.g. https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/3164 

I understand this is a judgement call, and there could be reasons I don't know about to keep the default as es5. If so, I'd like to hear what those are, since I believe it is better to move forward. Apps that have to support Internet Explorer already need to include some polyfills, and I think they're in the minority, so the default should cater to the majority -- users that really *should* be targeting ES6, and may not even think to change the settings in their `tsconfig.json` file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Default target should be ES6 in generated tsconfig.json" (#13352)

Windows 10
-->


### Repro steps
Followed steps in the official doc for setting up the service worker: https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-getting-started

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
No errors, all goes well but when loading the app in the browser the service worker is not being registered.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
**Temp solution**: manually registering the service worker in the main.ts file solves the issue:
```
platformBrowserDynamic().bootstrapModule(AppModule).then(() => {
  if ('serviceWorker' in navigator && environment.production) {
    navigator.serviceWorker.register('/ngsw-worker.js');
  }
}).catch(err => console.log(err));
```

1. I had an existing project with two apps on it.
2. ng generate library etpMenu

BUILD ERROR
../etp-menu/src/projects/bookingtome.ts(5,15): error TS2307: Cannot find module './lib/etp-menu.service'.

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): generate ngsw-config.json under the project
Issues.Body:
Generate `ngsw-config.json` under the project sourceRoot if root is empty similar to the `karma.conf.js`

Now:
```
-- src
---- ngsw-config.json
-- project
---- app
------ ngsw-config.json
```
Current:
```
-- ngsw-config.json
-- src
-- project
---- app
------ ngsw-config.json
```

Fixes #10793
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@schematics/angular): generate ngsw-config.json under the project" (#13346)

Issues.Title: Is this possible to change script path after build?
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
```

### Versions

Output from: 
`node --version` -> `8.11.3`
 `npm --version` -> `5.6.0`
 `ng-cli` -> `7.1.3`
 

### Repro steps
 if you give `ng build` command it create build file inside dist folder.

In this folder index.html file looks like this

>   <app-root></app-root>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="runtime.js"></script>
> 
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="polyfills.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="styles.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="vendor.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="main.js"></script>
> </body>



### Desired functionality

here i want to change path of this script file like below

>   <app-root></app-root>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="~/runtime.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="~/polyfills.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="~/styles.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="~/vendor.js"></script>
>   <script type="text/javascript" src="~/main.js"></script>
> </body>
> 

**### old path**: <script type="text/javascript" **src="runtime.js"**></script>
 
**### expected path:** <script type="text/javascript" **src="~/runtime.js"**></script>

### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->

Issues.Title: ng g service - provideIn configuration
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
7.1.4


### Repro steps
When user trying to generate a service with `ng g service my-service`, by default it puts `provideIn: 'root'` option without any options


### Desired functionality
Add option for service schematic that will allot users to generate a service without `provideIn` option or specify the target.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
I'd like to suggest 2 possible solutions:
1. Allow user to specify provider target (string), default value should be 'root'. User could specify a module symbol or empty string (will not add option to Injectable decorator).
2. Allow user to disable `provideIn` option during generation with bool option.

If you find this feature useful, I'll be happy to prepare a PR for it ;)

Issues.Title: Emulated view encapsulation invalidly compiles CSS custom properties in media queries
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->
node 9.4.0
npm 5.6.0
ng cli 7.1.3

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->

Create a new component with scss or css styles (either one will repro the bug). In the styles, define a custom property scoped under a media query:
```css
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  --kazaam: 'blue';
}
```

### Desired functionality

CSS custom properties should be compiled as-is and not suffixed, however they get compiled like this:
```css
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  --kazaam[_ngcontent-c2]: 'blue'[_ngcontent-c2];
}
```
CSS custom properties should be left unsuffixed, because it is invalid syntax.

### Mention any other details that might be useful

A workaround is to nest them in a class, though they shouldn't need to be nested. 

The same issue occurs for custom properties supplied under `:root` (:root gets prefixed) though it could be argued those should be defined in the global stylesheet. Custom properties defined under `:host` or a class are compiled properly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Emulated view encapsulation invalidly compiles CSS custom properties in media queries" (#13333)

<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->


### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
@angular-devkit/build-angular 0.11.4 is has a fixed dependency on license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2.
license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2 has an issue https://github.com/xz64/license-webpack-plugin/pull/57 that causes the build to fail when if the guessed name is a folder instead of a file.
Issue has since been fixed in license-webpack-plugin as of 2.0.3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Production build fails due to dependency on license-webpack-plugin 2.0.2" (#13329)

Issues.Title: Add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection
Issues.Body:
### Need to add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection and add it in angular.json

This is a Feature Request. My idea is to add a flag while creating a new angular project.
The flag should make OnPush changeDetection as the default.

ForExample:
ng new new-project --changeDetection=OnPush
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add flag for OnPush ChangeDetection" (#13327)

Issues.Title: Allow Port to be null in angular.json
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```


### Desired functionality

The scenario I am talking about is this:

ng serve --host local-address

and omitting the port completly

i have edited my hosts file for definition of google.dev

Where local-address is on a private network and not accessibly directly from the web. In the above instance, you only need to add host to ng serve and the port is taken care internally by hosts file & nginx.

In this scenario, running the following

ng serve --host google.dev --disable-host-check

will load the page with default port which is not required and can be omitted as it is taken care internally by nginx.

### Mention any other details that might be useful

i have google.dev pointing to localhost in hosts file
`127.0.0.1   google.dev`

and in my nginx i do proxy pass
```
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name google.dev;
    location / {
        proxy_set_header   Host      $http_host;
        proxy_pass         http://127.0.0.1:4200;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
	proxy_connect_timeout       300;
	proxy_send_timeout          300;
	proxy_read_timeout          300;
	send_timeout                300;
    }
}

```

so this can be fixed if the port allowed null in angular.json

```
"projects": {
    "my-cool-project": {
        ... rest of project config omitted
        "architect": {
            "serve": {
                "options": {
                   "host": "google.dev"
                    "port": null // allowing null would load the url without port
                }
            }
        }
    }
}


```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow Port to be null in angular.json" (#13326)

Issues.Title: Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report
```
- [x] bug report
```

### Command
```
- [x] new
```

### Versions
CLI v7.2.0-rc.0

### Repro steps
`ng new demoapp`

### The log given by the failure
Install TS 3.2, due to angular/angular-cli#13226

### Desired functionality
Should continue to install TS 3.1.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
Angular 7.0 and 7.1 supported TypeScript 3.1 only. Angular 7.2 now supports TypeScript 3.1 and TypeScript 3.2.

But **installing TypeScript 3.2 directly is a breaking change**, as it means a higher TypeScript version is required for the whole project.

Why? Because Angular 7.2 may support TS 3.2, but any real-world app will also rely on third-party libraries that may not be compatible with TS 3.2 yet, or even that can't be compatible with TS 3.2 (example: [one my lib is affected by a regression in TS 3.2](https://github.com/cyrilletuzi/angular-async-local-storage/issues/64)).

This is why Angular will only requires TS 3.2 (or newer) in the next *major* version, but still supports TS 3.1 in minor versions.

This is also confirmed by the CLI code itself which says [here](https://github.com/alan-agius4/angular-cli/blob/9ec504eb5d0b7559389c53ada4fa0bbbbfa3061b/packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts#L10):
```ts
// These versions should be kept up to date with latest Angular peer dependencies.
```

But Angular 7.2 `peerDependencies` is not TypeScript `~3.2.2`, it's `>=3.1.1 <3.3` (see [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/compiler-cli/package.json#L27)).

So the CLI may use the latest supported TS 3.2 internally, but should not install the latest one in the project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Installing/updating TypeScript 3.2 with CLI 7.2 is a breaking change" (#13323)

Issues.Title: Mat Tab breaks animation state by setting to void
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When Child components of mat-tab have angular animation, the state of the animation should not be affected by switching tabs.

#### What is the current behavior?
When child components of mat-tab have angular animation, switching tabs will cause the state of the animation to be set to void, thus breaking the UI of the child components.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-d8fjgg
In the demo, we have 3 states, expanded state will expand the div height to 300px, collapsed state will collapse the div height to 30px, and void state will set the div height to 150px.
Switching tabs will always reset the div height to 150px, regardless of what the actual current state is.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.0.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Tab breaks animation state by setting to void" (#14704)

Issues.Title: Strange border on the first and last <mat-expansion-panel> children of <mat-accordion> when using the Chrome browser
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Identical look and feel across all major/known/usual browsers.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently when using the **Chrome** browser I get strange looking `<mat-expansion-panel>` borders, more specifically on a `<mat-accordion>`'s first and last `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements during their **collapsed** state.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
The issue can be observed at https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/examples on the **collapsed** `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements when using the latest version of Chrome (71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)).
https://www.screencast.com/t/HWwmpIfA6ksg


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
The issue seems to be related to "@angular/material" 7.2.0 as it can be observed in the official documentation pages. I've only been able to detect this issue using Chrome (71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit) on my PC. On the mobile Chrome browser the issue is not manifesting.
The issue is **NOT** manifesting on IE 11.472.17134.0 (update versions 11.0.101), Microsoft Edge 42.17134.1.0 and Firefox 64.0 (64-bit).

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It seems like the **box-shadow** of the first and last `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements is somehow shifted towards the bottom-right corner as it is too thick on the bottom and right side of those `<mat-expansion-panel>` elements and it is not present almost at all on the left side.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Strange border on the first and last <mat-expansion-panel> children of <mat-accordion> when using the Chrome browser" (#14686)

Issues.Title: MatTable + MatSort example not working properly: Table retrieving data through HTTP
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Default ordering when loading screen works.

#### What is the current behavior?

Default sort order is not applied.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Go to examples https://v6.material.angular.io/components/table/examples
2. Search for: `Table retrieving data through HTTP`
3. Wrong result (I'll explain below)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular Documentation 6.4.7 and 7.2.0, the other versions maybe

#### Is there anything else we should know?

The default sort order when loading screen is not being applied: `matSortActive="created" matSortDirection="asc"`

**Reason:** `MatSort` becomes initialized only in hook `ngAfterViewInit`, but its information is being used before `ngAfterViewInit` due to `startWith({})`.

Adding a
```ts
console.log(`requestUrl: ${requestUrl}`);`
```
in `getRepoIssues` you can see that the request made is with `sort = undefined` and `order is empty`. Look: `requestUrl: https://api.github.com/search/issues?q=repo:angular/material2&sort=undefined&order=&page=1`

**Solution I propose:** remove `startWith({})` and observe whether `MatSort` is initialized by replacing `merge(this.sort.sortChange, this.paginator.page)` with `merge(this.sort.initialized, this.sort.sortChange, this.paginator.page)`.

`startWith({})` is no longer necessary because the startup of `MatSort` will already trigger the request.

I made a fork from the example quoted above and applied the changes I described here. Follow: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-shhprk?file=app/table-http-example.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTable + MatSort example not working properly: Table retrieving data through HTTP" (#14683)

Issues.Title: No examples of pre-built website templates using Material for Angular
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Adding examples of pre-built full website templates built with Material for Angular would be a great help for companies (especially startups and small companies) to get started with the project. For example a blog site, portfolio, simple website for a small business, etc.  

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

- I'm a developer with little knowledge on website designing. When learning about Angular and trying to build a quick website, i could not find many examples. The main [Angular Material website](https://material.angular.io/) does not have any such examples.

- Most examples were more about "apps" and little focus on websites being built with Material. 

- We cannot build website quickly on Angular with Material without these examples. We have to build the site on Material then translate (into components) that design to Angular project. Developers need to spend a lot of time on this.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
1.  Material site has a tutorial of a full website but again we need to translate (as components) that into angular project - https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/mdc-102-web/#0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No examples of pre-built website templates using Material for Angular" (#14680)
